poem:
"Upon Wealth Deferred"

With promise of cutting,
the chancellor hints, a song
for the high earner.
His words float,
like a mist over the clamoring 
commerce of morning.
Labour, too, proposes, 
a lighter burden to bear.
Promises held like coins
in closed fists.
Political tune,
unfurls the dawn,
a dance of silver
upon the wanting.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Jeremy Hunt hints Tories would cut taxes for higher earners if re-elected The chancellor, Jeremy Hunt, has hinted he would cut taxes for higher earners if the Conservatives are re-elected, saying they disincentivised people from working harder. As both parties began to set out their economic plans on the first weekend of campaigning, Labour’s Rachel Reeves also said she wants taxes on working people to be lower, and promised never to “play fast and loose”". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
